tool.name: FeatureFinderIdentification
tool.description: Detects features in MS1 data based on peptide identifications.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir id && ln -s '$id' 'id/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $id.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($id.ext)' && #if $id_ext: mkdir id_ext && ln -s '$id_ext' 'id_ext/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $id_ext.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($id_ext.ext)' && #end if mkdir out && #if "lib_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir lib_out && #end if #if "chrom_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir chrom_out && #end if #if "candidates_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir candidates_out && #end if #if "xval_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir svm_xval_out && #end if #if $adv_opts_cond.adv_opts_selector=='advanced': #if $adv_opts_cond.candidates_in: mkdir adv_opts_cond.candidates_in && ln -s '$adv_opts_cond.candidates_in' 'adv_opts_cond.candidates_in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $adv_opts_cond.candidates_in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($adv_opts_cond.candidates_in.ext)' && #end if #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -id 'id/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $id.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($id.ext)' #if $id_ext: -id_ext 'id_ext/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $id_ext.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($id_ext.ext)' #end if -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' #if "lib_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -lib_out 'lib_out/output.${gxy2omsext("traml")}' #end if #if "chrom_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -chrom_out 'chrom_out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' #end if #if "candidates_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -candidates_out 'candidates_out/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' #end if #if "xval_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -svm:xval_out 'svm_xval_out/output.${gxy2omsext("csv")}' #end if #if $adv_opts_cond.adv_opts_selector=='advanced': #if $adv_opts_cond.candidates_in: -candidates_in 'adv_opts_cond.candidates_in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $adv_opts_cond.candidates_in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($adv_opts_cond.candidates_in.ext)' #end if #end if #if len(str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',')) == 0 | tee '$stdout' #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' '$out' #if "lib_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'lib_out/output.${gxy2omsext("traml")}' '$lib_out' #end if #if "chrom_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'chrom_out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$chrom_out' #end if #if "candidates_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'candidates_out/output.${gxy2omsext("featurexml")}' '$candidates_out' #end if #if "xval_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'svm_xval_out/output.${gxy2omsext("csv")}' '$svm_xval_out' #end if #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: Input file: LC-MS raw data

param.name: id
param.label: Input file: Peptide identifications derived directly from 'in'

param.name: id_ext
param.label: Input file: 'External' peptide identifications
param.help: (e.g. from aligned runs) select idxml data sets(s)

param.name: batch_size
param.label: Nr of peptides used in each batch of chromatogram extraction
param.help: Smaller values decrease memory usage but increase runtime

param.name: mz_window
param.label: m/z window size for chromatogram extraction (unit: ppm if 1 or greater, else Da/Th)

param.name: n_isotopes
param.label: Number of isotopes to include in each peptide assay

param.name: isotope_pmin
param.label: Minimum probability for an isotope to be included in the assay for a peptide
param.help: If set, this parameter takes precedence over 'extract:n_isotopes'

param.name: rt_quantile
param.label: Quantile of the RT deviations between aligned internal and external IDs to use for scaling the RT extraction window

param.name: rt_window
param.label: RT window size (in sec.) for chromatogram extraction
param.help: If set, this parameter takes precedence over 'extract:rt_quantile'

section.name: detect
section.title: Parameters for detecting features in extracted ion chromatograms

param.name: peak_width
param.label: Expected elution peak width in seconds, for smoothing (Gauss filter)
param.help: Also determines the RT extration window, unless set explicitly via 'extract:rt_window'

param.name: min_peak_width
param.label: Minimum elution peak width
param.help: Absolute value in seconds if 1 or greater, else relative to 'peak_width'

param.name: signal_to_noise
param.label: Signal-to-noise threshold for OpenSWATH feature detection

param.name: mapping_tolerance
param.label: RT tolerance (plus/minus) for mapping peptide IDs to features
param.help: Absolute value in seconds if 1 or greater, else relative to the RT span of the feature

section.name: svm
section.title: Parameters for scoring features using a support vector machine (SVM)

param.name: samples
param.label: Number of observations to use for training ('0' for all)

param.name: no_selection
param.label: By default, roughly the same number of positive and negative observations, with the same intensity distribution, are selected for training
param.help: This aims to reduce biases, but also reduces the amount of training data. Set this flag to skip this procedure and consider all available observations (subject to 'svm:samples')

param.name: kernel
param.label: SVM kernel

param.name: xval
param.label: Number of partitions for cross-validation (parameter optimization)

param.name: log2_C
param.label: Values to try for the SVM parameter 'C' during parameter optimization
param.help: A value 'x' is used as 'C = 2^x' (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: log2_gamma
param.label: Values to try for the SVM parameter 'gamma' during parameter optimization (RBF kernel only)
param.help: A value 'x' is used as 'gamma = 2^x' (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: epsilon
param.label: Stopping criterion

param.name: cache_size
param.label: Size of the kernel cache (in MB)

param.name: no_shrinking
param.label: Disable the shrinking heuristics

param.name: predictors
param.label: Names of OpenSWATH scores to use as predictors for the SVM (comma-separated list)

param.name: min_prob
param.label: Minimum probability of correctness, as predicted by the SVM, required to retain a feature candidate

section.name: model
section.title: Parameters for fitting elution models to features

param.name: type
param.label: Type of elution model to fit to features

param.name: add_zeros
param.label: Add zero-intensity points outside the feature range to constrain the model fit
param.help: This parameter sets the weight given to these points during model fitting; '0' to disable

param.name: unweighted_fit
param.label: Suppress weighting of mass traces according to theoretical intensities when fitting elution models

param.name: no_imputation
param.label: If fitting the elution model fails for a feature, set its intensity to zero instead of imputing a value from the initial intensity estimate

param.name: each_trace
param.label: Fit elution model to each individual mass trace

section.name: check
section.title: Parameters for checking the validity of elution models (and rejecting them if necessary)

param.name: min_area
param.label: Lower bound for the area under the curve of a valid elution model

param.name: boundaries
param.label: Time points corresponding to this fraction of the elution model height have to be within the data region used for model fitting

param.name: width
param.label: Upper limit for acceptable widths of elution models (Gaussian or EGH), expressed in terms of modified (median-based) z-scores
param.help: '0' to disable. Not applied to individual mass traces (parameter 'each_trace')

param.name: asymmetry
param.label: Upper limit for acceptable asymmetry of elution models (EGH only), expressed in terms of modified (median-based) z-scores
param.help: '0' to disable. Not applied to individual mass traces (parameter 'each_trace')

param.name: candidates_in
param.label: Input file: Feature candidates from a previous run
param.help: If set, only feature classification and elution model fitting are carried out, if enabled. Many parameters are ignored select featurexml data sets(s)

param.name: force
param.label: Overrides tool-specific checks

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs
param.option: candidates_out (Output file: Feature candidates (before filtering and model fitting))
xval_out (Output file: SVM cross-validation (parameter optimization) results)

data.name: lib_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: lib_out
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "lib_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: chrom_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: chrom_out
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "chrom_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: candidates_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: candidates_out
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "candidates_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: svm_xval_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: svm:xval_out
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "xval_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Detects features in MS1 data based on peptide identifications.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/release/2.6.0/html/TOPP_FeatureFinderIdentification.html
